page.title: 18FOOTBALL TEAM SWANAGE
page.content: On 27th April 1985 we went to Bovington to play six-a-side football. One of the girls brought along a teddy bear as a mascot. Bill, our football coach, took us to the changing rooms where we put on our kit and waited for play. Our first game was against Herston and we beat them 1-0. We were all very happy about winning the game. We then played Sandford who were very good, but we managed to beat them 2-0. By now we felt very confident because we only had to beat Corfe Castle to get into the semi-finals. Luck stayed with us and we won again, 1-0. We had to play Wareham in the semi-finals and they were a very tough side. It was the hardest game we had played so far in the competition, but we beat them 2-0.
